alert.note: Alert for Henry; Mercer; Rock Island; Warren (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Warren, south central Rock Island, eastern Mercer and southwestern Henry Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 630 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lynn Center, or 11 miles west of Cambridge, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... New Windsor around 645 PM CDT. Woodhull, Alpha and New Windsor around 650 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include North Henderson. This includes Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 19 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
